item.title: Contractors Rubbish, 14th August
item.description:
Following your contractors replacing the damaged drain covers, they have left this area in appalling condition. They have left all the repair rubbish all over this area. Peabody should have them return to clear up this mess. It might be woodlands but they would not been allowed to leave all this rubbish if it was in a street. I can't belive that Peabody had not checked on there work.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastern Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Next to the tree outside block 1-8 Marlborough Mansions, 14th August
item.description:
The Pavement is very unstable and a trip hazard mulptiple of our residents have trips and hurt themselevs luckily no serious injuries. you have tried to repair it multiple times but never works and it is getting worse. something needs to be done properly once and for all.

item.title: Flytipping In Garages, 14th August
item.description:
There is a large build up of flytipping at the garages in Buckland Court. This includes dismantled furniture, parts of a transit van, and a large water container that the building surveyors didn't bother to clean up. It has been here several weeks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cranston Estate, Hackney, London

item.title: Vomit In Stairwell, 14th August
item.description:
There is a dried pool of vomit half way up the north stairway in Buckland Court. It has been partially cleaned but there are still large chunks and splash marks. It has been here since last week.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Johns Estate, Hackney, London

item.title: Urine In Stairwell, 14th August

item.title: Trees impacting properties on Charlton Lane, 14th August
item.description:
Iâ€™ve reported this issue many times. The trees at the top of Charlton Lane have not been maintained for years. They are now so large that they are touching the properties and blocking the guttering with leaves. I am concerned that there will be a serious incident with a batch hitting a property in a storm. The dry weather is also impacting the trees, causing leaf stress. What are the council going to do about this , wait till the problem worsens or act now?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Lane, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees need pruning in Martens Grove Park alongside 8 Holly Gardens, 14th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holly Gardens, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Commercial trailer unattached and advertising dumped on street for last month, 14th August
item.description:
Trailer abandoned, unattached, trailers by law should be attached to pulling vehicle if left on public highway, advertising which is against local rules, hazardous as no permanent warning lights, needs a skip licence as effectively doing that, depriving locals of parking space in area with little available parking, here for over a month

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thorpewood Avenue, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Main road on post code da159he the concreate plate as broken causing house to shake, 14th August
item.description:
This as been an ongoing problem for many years out side number 68 wellington avenue but needs a proper fix not just a patch up Conway who did the last road resurfacing told the us and the neighbor's this will not work as the plate as broken but this is a large job and mean closing the road for longer but this is a main through road for public transport It as now got to a point were we have many cracks inside the house and being kept awake at night with the shaking So not only is the house getting damaged our quality of live is being affected The damage to the road is 3mts wide Either the road needs resurfacing that is good for just over a year or a full structural repair needs doing ASAP
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68, Wellington Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
